title: Australia mourns radio legend John Laws | 7NEWS
description: Legendary Australian radio broadcaster John Laws has passed away a year and a half after retiring from radio station 2SM. Laws was renowned for his exceptional ability to connect with listeners and callers, earning recognition as Australia's best broadcaster across a 71-year career that saw him speak with 17 prime ministers. His influence extended far beyond Sydney, championing regional Australia and providing a voice for rural communities through his extensive national radio network. title: Toyah Cordingley murder trial begins in Cairns | 7NEWS
description: Rajwinder Singh, 41, goes on trial for the murder of 24-year-old Toyah Cordingley, whose body was found buried in sand on Wangetti Beach south of Port Douglas in October 2018. The trial is expected to span three to four weeks, with Singh pleading not guilty to the charges brought against him in 2022. title: Coalition claws back support after net zero turmoil | 7NEWS
description: The Coalition's primary vote has increased by one percentage point to 29% according to new Resolve Political Monitor figures, following a period of internal conflict over net zero policy. Opposition leader Sussan Ley has gained three net points as preferred Prime Minister. The Liberal Party is expected to finalise its energy policy position by Thursday. title: 'It's ridiculous': more US flights impacted by government shutdown
description: Passengers have been left stranded as thousands of flights are being cancelled daily in the US due to the prolonged government shutdown. This has been the longest shut down on record meaning public sector workers, including air traffic controllers, aren't being paid. #governmentshutdown #USpolitics #airport #travel #airplane

title: US ends historic 40-day government shutdown | 7NEWS
description: The US government is set to end its record-breaking 40-day shutdown after Senate Democrats agreed to a deal funding the government through January. The agreement includes promises for a vote on Obacare subsidies, job restoration for furloughed federal workers, and back pay, though airport disruptions will take at least a week to fully resolve. title: Australian military secrets exposed in cyber attack | 7NEWS
description: Classified plans for Australia's seven billion dollar Redback infantry fighting vehicles have been exposed in a cyber attack on Israeli defence companies. The hacking group Cyber Toufan, believed to have Iranian state backing, breached 17 Israeli military sites and posted 3D renderings and technical data of the Redback online. The breach occurred because one of the targeted Israeli companies supplies advanced weapons turrets for Australia's new infantry fighting vehicle. title: Princess Anne honours fallen officers in Melbourne | 7NEWS
description: Princess Anne has visited Melbourne as part of a four-day Australian tour, paying tribute to fallen police officers at the police memorial on St Kilda Road and conducting military duties at Simpson Barracks. The Princess Royal met with police officials, Premier Jacinta Allen, and families of fallen officers Neil Thompson and Vadim Devart-Hotar, presenting wreaths and observing a minute's silence. She inspected military equipment including specialised trucks and satellite equipment during her visit to the barracks in Melbourne's northeast. title: Digital poisoning fights AI deepfakes | 7NEWS
description: A new artificial intelligence powered tool called 'digital poisoning' corrupts online data to make it harder for cybercriminals to create AI generated deepfakes. The technique is part of a joint initiative between Monash University and the Australian Federal Police aimed at disrupting the spread of child abuse material and extremist propaganda. The tool works by altering pixels in online content and flagging malicious material with authorities. title: BBC bosses resign over Trump documentary editing | 7NEWS
description: Two senior BBC executives, Director-General Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness, have resigned following controversy over the broadcaster's editing of a Donald Trump speech in a documentary. The White House criticised the BBC's editing of Trump's address before the Capitol insurrection as misleading, with the US President calling the executives 'corrupt journalists' and 'dishonest people'. title: Super typhoon devastates Philippines | 7NEWS
description: Super Typhoon Fung Wong has struck the northern Philippines with sustained winds exceeding 240 kilometres per hour, forcing one million people to evacuate their homes. The typhoon killed two people before making landfall and follows last week's Typhoon Kalmegi which claimed 224 lives. Australia's embassy has closed due to dangerous conditions, whilst hundreds of flights have been cancelled and multiple airports shut down. title: MPs refer death threats to NSW Police after condemning Sydney neo-Nazi rally
description: Federal MP Allegra Spender and NSW MP Kellie Sloane have referred threats of death and violence to police after they condemned Saturday's neo-Nazi rally outside state parliament. #allegraspender #kelliesloane #auspol #nswpol #sydney

title: ACCC warns of dodgy Black Friday tactics | 7NEWS
description: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission is warning shoppers about deceptive Black Friday sales tactics including false urgency deals, misleading storewide bargains, and percentage discounts that only apply to limited products. The ACCC is actively monitoring retailers and prepared to take enforcement action against companies that breach consumer protection rules, particularly repeat offenders. title: THE DEBRIEF: Albanese faces polling pressure amid cost concerns | 7NEWS
description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley gains three points in polling as preferred Prime Minister while 42 per cent of voters blame the federal government for the cost of living crisis, signalling potential challenges for Anthony Albanese's administration. A father of five, Dani Elachi, has decided not to give his children smartphones until age 18 after regretting giving his eldest daughter a phone at 10 years old. Large running clubs at Bondi Beach have sparked debate after viral footage showed massive groups disrupting the peaceful sunrise experience for other beachgoers. title: Daily coffee protects heart health | 7NEWS
description: University of Adelaide researchers have discovered that drinking one cup of coffee daily reduces the risk of irregular heartbeat while providing protection against heart failure and stroke. This finding contradicts conventional medical advice that typically recommends people with irregular heartbeats avoid coffee consumption.
